title: Industry Surveys
text:
Production & Orders
Core metrics that define the operational health of businesses, reflecting demand dynamics and production efficiency. By examining these figures in the aggregate, stakeholders gain insights into the sector’s capacity utilization, supply chain performance, and market trends and cycles.

title: Industry Surveys
text:
Inputs & Prices
Key data on the sector’s profitability and competitive landscape, reflecting impacts of economic conditions, regulatory changes, and industry resilience. This provides stakeholders with insights into the industry’s overall financial performance, enabling informed business and policy decisions regarding regulatory issues, resource allocations, and investment strategies.

title: Industry Surveys
text:
Labour
Workforce dynamics indicators reflecting changes in industry employment and the impacts of labor market conditions. For policymakers, this information is essential for crafting labour regulations and training programs that support growth, while investors also benefit from understanding labour trends, which directly influence operational efficiency and profitability.

title: Industry Surveys
text:
Investment & Innovation
Essential figures gauging capital expenditures and investments, reflecting the industry’s confidence in future growth and innovation potential. By monitoring spending trends, stakeholders can assess the sector’s medium and long-term outlook, while policymakers can use this information to design incentive structures that support industry needs.

title: Industry Surveys
text:
Benefits for data providers
Data providers demonstrate leadership and help advance their sectors by supporting evidence-based policies and strategic business decisions. Participating in Bridge2Food’s Industry Surveys also offers additional incentives:

Exclusive or early access to data releases and special reports
Optional feature of company logo on data products
Free or discounted attendance in Bridge2Food events

To express interest in participating as a data provider, please contact vincent.brain@bridge2food.com.

title: Industry Intelligence
text:
Benchmark data and sector analysis


We provide open-access data and reporting products to help align policies and strategies with the outcomes they intend.


Industry Surveys
Bridge2Food’s Industry Surveys, co-funded by the European Union, provide benchmark data for the sustainable food and protein sectors. Each quarter, we publish a series of key indicators, offering policymakers, investors, and other stakeholders valuable insight into the industry’s status and outlook.
Learn more about our Industry Surveys.


Reporting Products
We produce open-access, exclusive, and bespoke reports leveraging our Industry Survey data and other Bridge2Food network resources.
To learn more about our reporting products, send an email to communication@bridge2food.com.

title: About Bridge2Food Research
text:
The industry intelligence and science communication arm of Bridge2Food


We address global food and agriculture challenges by bridging knowledge gaps between industry, academia, and policy to:

Facilitate evidence-based decisions and policy-making processes
Accelerate the development and implementation of high-impact technologies
Raise standards for how science is communicated and harnessed

Through the provision of information, data, and analysis, Bridge2Food Research helps establish rigorous baselines for understanding complex, multifaceted topics. By doing so, we foster public and private sector alignment with scientific knowledge, while bringing to light untapped opportunities for collaboration and problem solving at scale.

title: Research Projects
text: Translating research into reality

title: Research Projects
text:
Giant Leaps
GIANT LEAPS is the Horizon Europe-funded research project delivering strategic innovations, methodologies, and open-access datasets to accelerate the shift toward more sustainable and healthy food systems.



Bringing together 35 partners from 13 EU member states and 4 associated and affiliated countries (Canada, Serbia, Switzerland, United Kingdom), the GIANT LEAPS consortium works in line with the Farm to Fork Strategy and European Green Deal target of reaching climate neutrality by 2050.
Learn more on the Giant Leaps website.

title: Research Projects
text:
HealthFerm
HealthFerm is the EU-funded research project investigating innovative pulse and cereal-based food fermentations together with the health effects and consumer perception of novel fermented foods.



With 23 partners from across Europe, HealthFerm is committed to transitioning towards a more sustainable global food system by setting new standards for individual, societal, and planetary health through increased and more resource-efficient use of plant-based raw materials in foods.
Learn more on the HealthFerm website.

title: Research Projects
text:
Plenitude
PLENITUDE is the EU-funded flagship project pioneering the mycoprotein value chain of the future.



By bringing together 10 partners from across Europe, PLENITUDE leverages an innovative, circular bioprocess integrating the production of bio ethanol and mycoprotein to build new value chains for bio-based products that can provide a range of environmental, economic, and public health benefits.
Learn more on the PLENITUDE website.

title: Research Projects
text:
ProFuture
ProFuture was a four-year research project funded under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 program, spanning from 2019 to 2023.



The project’s aim was to scale microalgae production and prepare the market for uptake of microalgae proteins as ingredients for innovative and sustainable food and feed products. Bringing together 31 partners across academia and industry, ProFuture was coordinated by the Institute of Agrifood Research and Technology (IRTA) in Spain. The final conference of ProFuture took place on 13th and 14th of September 2023 in Brussels.
Learn more on the ProFuture website.

title: Industry Surveys
text:
Benefits for respondents
Respondent companies demonstrate leadership by supporting an evidence-based policy framework for their sector. Participating in Bridge2Food’s Industry Surveys also offers exclusive benefits:

Pre-public access to data releases and special reports
Optional feature of company logo on data products

To express interest in participating in Bridge2Food’s Industry Surveys, please contact vincent.brain@bridge2food.com.

title: Industry Analyst (IA) Survey
text:
The Industry Analyst (IA) Survey harnesses the expertise of analysts from the nonprofit, academic, and public sectors. By querying professionals who possess deep understanding of market dynamics, technological change, and the intended and unintended impacts of policies, this survey provides insight into what is happening behind the trends observed in other industry surveys.
View the questionnaire.

Survey Participants

title: Industry Analyst (IA) Survey
text: Survey Participants

title: Plant Protein Supplier (PPS) Survey
text:
The Plant Protein Supplier (PPS) Survey captures benchmark data from the plant protein ingredient and equipment sectors. Each quarter, the survey delivers valuable insights into the industry’s status and outlook, providing essential information for policymakers, investors, and other stakeholders.
The Plant Protein Supplier (PPS) Survey is an indispensable tool for companies in the plant protein sector, providing comprehensive insights into supply chain dynamics, technological advancements, market trends, and regulatory factors. By participating in this survey, suppliers can enhance their strategic planning, drive innovation, and contribute to the growth and sustainability of the plant protein industry.
View the questionnaire.

Respondent Companies
